text: JACOB JOHNSON is sleeping.  It doesn't look like a pleasa experience.  He is sixteen, dirty blonde, his eyes visibl moving under closed lids as he sits huddle under a blanke his window seat.  The lights are dim -- the shade on the  window closed -- a bead of sweat dribbles down his forehe The HUMMING of the jet's engines vibrates through the cab The boy's eyes snap open. Jacob glances around nervously.  He looks like an escaped convict who just accidentally walked into the Policemen's Ball.  A GREYHAIRED MAN two seats away from him gives the teenager a cursory glance, then goes back to his book.  J lays his head back and tries to relax.  The engines conti to drone. Until a new noise starts.  A WHOOSHING NOISE. The sound is very faint.  But distinct from everything el Jacob frowns. The noise gets LOUDER.  Jacob's sure he's hearing it now. looks at the Greyhaired Man.  The man catches his eye and two of them stare at each other for a heartbeat - then Ja turns away.  The Man returns to his book.  And Jacob  immediately turns back to him.
Do you hear that? The man gives him an annoyed look as the WHOOSHING gets  louder.
Hear what?
That noise.

I don't hear anything. The man turns back to the book as the sound gets even LOU - like it's coming closer.  Jacob squirms in his seat --  sneaks a look at the man again.  How can he not hear that STEWARDESS walks by and Jacob catches her attention.
Excuse me.
Yes? The WHOOSHING is completely obvious now.  The greyhaired tries to ignore the two people talking over him.
What is that sound?
That's just the engines, sir.
No, it's different.  It's not the  engines.  It's getting louder. The man sighs -- the stewardess smiles patronizingly.
We're just gaining altitude to get above  some rough weather.  That's the sound of  the engines speeding up a bit.   Everything's fine.

Um...okay. The stewardess walks away as Jacob sits back and starts t bite his nails.  The whooshing is really starting to BLAR now.  He looks between the seats in front of him -- twist around to look behind.  He snaps back to the greyhaired m JACOB (cont'd)
Can't you hear that? GREYHAIRED MAN (losing patience)

Look, kid.  Will you relax?  It's just  the damn engines, okay? The man glares at him, and Jacob backs off.  The sound ha grown DEAFENING.  Jacob grinds his seat like he's going m He looks at the closed window.  He reaches out his hand,  grabs the handle then rips up the shade for all to see: A 747 coming RIGHT AT US. Jacob SCREAMS.  The planes CRASH. Impact - decompression - explosion.  The hull of the cabi buckles violently - moaning like a dying elephant - peeli inward revealing RED AND GREEN STRIPING on the outside. A huge wing section RIPS through the structure - barely  missing Jacob - taking the greyhaired man's head clean of nailing the stewardess in the gut and shoving her body ac and out the other side of the cabin. And Jacob's seat drops down - sending him and us into:

Like an intricate ballet, Jacob, his body strapped to his chair, tumbles away from the DC-10 and 747 as they seem t merge and bend into some kind of mutant DC-47 - wings and tails wrapping around each other as debris blooms out lik flower and together they EXPLODE - a fiery ball lighting nighttime clouds and Jacob's shrieking face.   And Jacob falls and falls and falls, his hair sticking  straight up from the blasting wind. That's when CORPSES start falling past him.  The captain the plane - the stewardess, her body bent in half - the  greyhaired man, his head gone but his book still in his h More men, women, crew people - and CHILDREN. But these children aren't dead bodies.  Two LITTLE GIRLS one LITTLE BOY, all dressed in white, plummet down next t Jacob, head first, like high divers.  And they're singing THE CHILDREN

One two, Freddy's coming for you... The children turn around in the sky so that they are  travelling feet first.  The Little Boy's pants puff up an the Girls' skirts poof out and RIP UPWARD - the wind taki away their clothes and their skin and their bodies and th hair... THE CHILDREN (cont'd)
Three four, better lock your door... Leaving three tiny SKELETONS - taunting and laughing as J screams and covers his eyes. THE CHILDREN (cont'd)
Five six, grab your crucifix... And the Skeletons sprout wings - leathery and veiny - the wind catching them and sending them up and away as their  voices echo in the sky. THE CHILDREN (cont'd)

Seven eight, gonna stay up late... Jacob takes his hands away from his face and starts to  frantically pull on his seat belt.  SNAP - it flies off h back and miraculously turns into a PARACHUTE.  Rope swirl into the air - the wind grabs the canvas - and Jacob's bo slows with a violent jerk. But at least he's not falling anymore.  Jacob catches his breath as he starts gently floating through the sky.  He  smiles.  This isn't so bad.  This is actually kind of fun Not for long, though, because his new upward momentum car him back up to: The winged children's Skeletons.  Jacob's eyes bug out as rises into them and they start to circle.  They move clos and we can see something in their hands:
Jacob twists his body, trying to steer his parachute away from the demons.  One of the Skeletons swoops up to his f and pokes its scissors inches away from Jacob's eyes.  It sings alone: CHILD

Nine ten, never sleep again! The Skeleton cranks its arm back - ready to plunge the  scissor's blades into Jacob's sockets.  The arms swings  toward him - then suddenly diverts up past his head, head for:

The Skeleton flaps its wings and poises its scissors at o of the ropes.  The other two Skeletons join it over Jacob head.  The three of them look down at Jacob, their boney in a perpetual smile. JACOB

No! The Skeletons nod "yes".  SNIP - SNIP - SNIP - they cut a at Jacob's parachute as he swings underneath them, trying pull away - SNIP - SNIP. The parachute flutters away - the Skeletons cackle - and  Jacob plummets.

We stay with him as he screams and shrieks and yells and clouds part and the ground rises quickly up to meet him. ground becomes a town, the town becomes a block, the bloc becomes a house, the house becomes a roof, and...
KA-BLAM!  The ceiling explodes as Jacob's body plows thro slams down, shatters the bed, and we immediately:

Jacob's eyes blast open as he sits up from bed in a cold  sweat.  A dream.  The worst fucking dream from hell anyon would ever want to have -- but still just a dream.  He ta a few deep breaths as a soft KNOCK is heard at the door. JACOB
Yeah.. ALICE JOHNSON opens the door and sticks her head in.  She thirty-two, blonde, with a caring smile. ALICE
You okay, honey? JACOB
Yeah, Mom.  I'm fine. ALICE
Alright.  Better get cooking or you'll be  late for school. JACOB

On my way. Alice closes the door as Jacob gets out of bed and stretc Sunlight is leaking through the bedroom window shade and  Jacob walks over to it.  He reaches out and pulls up the  shade. And there's nothing buy sky.  Jacob frowns and pokes his out the window.
is once again racing up towards us at seven-thousand mile hour.  The entire house is falling.

Jacob leaps away from the window.  The WINGED SKELETONS  reappear outside -- dancing in the air -- cackling with g The bedroom starts to SHAKE violently as Jacob stumbles i the center.  The roof starts caving in and the walls begi to crumble. ANGLE STRAIGHT DOWN ON JACOB. Jacob grabs his head, looks up at us, and SCREAMS.  We  suddenly stay where we are as the house drops down and we punch out through the roof and our shot becomes an:
as it falls away towards the ground.  We watch as it beco a small dot - and finally impacts on the surface.  A mush cloud of smoke silently puffs out in the distance below

Smoke and dust whirl around a huge hole in the earth.   Splintered shreds of lumber stick up in the air like gian toothpicks.  Some of the toothpicks start to move. Jacob rises out of the destruction, charred, scraped,  battered and, unfortunately, alive.  He climbs up to the of the crater.  He looks back a the remnants of his home. Then something starts to happen. Something his growing from the crater - spreading out.  I not a cloud, it's not smoke - it's a DARKNESS.  Even thou it's night, this darkness is darker.  It creeps out from hole - fingers of blackness reaching out.  What it covers doesn't disappear.  It becomes GLOOMY.  The shroud is get bigger. And it's getting faster.  Jacob runs.

He bolts down the streets of the small town in a blind pa He looks behind him and sees the darkness getting bigger, gloominess covering houses.  Then whole blocks. Everything it touches seems to fall deeper into SHADOW.
Jacob comes across a WOMAN walking her dog.  He stops and yells at her. JACOB
Get the hell out of here!  It's coming! WOMAN

What's coming? Jacob points down the street.  The shroud is swooping dow the road - browning out street lights in its wake.  And t woman doesn't find anything threatening about this.  Jaco screams at her. JACOB
Don't you see it? WOMAN

See what? And it's obvious now: she doesn't see anything.  The Woma totally oblivious to the danger.  Jacob shakes his head - stumbles away. The woman watches him go as the darkness PASSES OVER HER. She sighs. And begins to MUTATE.  Her hair gets scraggly, her skin  bursts out in sores, her back grows a hump -- all of whic she DOESN'T seem to notice. She just shrugs her twisted shoulders. WOMAN (cont'd)
Kids...watcha gonna do? She hobbles away with her dog - which now has six legs an two heads.
Like a bat running from hell, he tears through the street passing buildings that turn creepy and people that become passively accepting monsters. A VOICE booms out from nowhere. FREDDY (O.S.)
Jacob!  You're too old to run away from  home! Jacob covers his ears and races out of town.

Jacob falls onto the deserted road just outside of town. rolls on the asphalt and looks behind him.  most of the t is covered in an opaque gloom.   Suddenly a CACKLING sound is heard and Jacob turns to its source:

The town can still be seen behind it -- the darkness over almost all of it now.  The sign reads: WELCOME TO SPRINGW POPULATION... And the numbers after the word "population" are changing. They're counting BACKWARDS, clattering away like an old-t gas pump in reverse - faster and faster - blurring as the "thousands" digit disappears, then the "hundreds", then  "tens", then... CLINK - the count stops at "1".  Springwood is entirely  engulfed in the shroud.  There is a pause. CRASH - the sign is violently YANKED into the ground.  It vanishes into the earth and a CRACK APPEARS at the edge o the road. The crack grows - moving out to the center of t highway.

Jacob watches the crack as it splits wider in the middle the street and a GURGLING sound starts to build.  The tar front of Jacob becomes molten.  It bubbles and pops. Jacob scrambles backwards as something begins to rise fro boiling asphalt. It's a hat. The hat, a fedora to be precise, pushes itself up. A left hand - burned and scarred - pokes out next to it.  Four s blades jut out of the muck on the other side.  A head is now - a curtain of tar dripping from the rim of the hat - hiding the face.  The body beneath the head ascends.  The veil of asphalt parts: It's FREDDY KRUEGER.  Jacob SCREAMS. Freddy LAUGHS.  He shakes off his layer of tar and looks  towards the clouded town of Springwood.  A look of pure  hatred appears on his ragged face. FREDDY

Payback time... Freddy opens his mouth - lets out a large breath - and th INHALES an even larger one. A WINDSTORM starts, the source being Krueger's own lungs. The gale force begins to yank at the shroud surrounding  Springwood.  Fingers of darkness pull up from the town an towards Freddy's mouth -- and houses begin to DISSOLVE.   Freddy continues to inhale like he's never going to stop. Krueger is sucking the black gloom into his body - and th entire town of Springwood is going with it.  Trees,  buildings, cars, picket fences.  It's all crumbling and  fusing, becoming a part of t cloud that itself is caught the nightmarish wind tunnel, all piling into Freddy's mou The vortex swirls into Krueger.  Then it's gone.  Nothing a vacant lot the size of a town remains.  Freddy turns to Jacob and BURPS, it sounds like a THUNDERCLAP. JACOB
No! FREDDY

Don't worry, I have a strong stomach. Freddy reaches down and yanks up his red and green sweate He pulls apart his putrid abdomen to reveal his guts - an transparent stomach. Inside the stomach: a black swirling mass.  Flashes of  houses, people, homes, couples, all trapped in horrible  anguish.  Freddy drops down his sweater. FREDDY (cont'd)
Springwood is mine, boy! JACOB
I dreamed you away before I was born!   Mom said you couldn't come back! FREDDY

Is that true?  Then she told you all  about me, huh? Let's see what else she  has to say. Freddy reaches his left hand into the bubbling tar at his feet, digs around a bit, then pulls out: ALICE.  Jacob's mother.  Tar dripping down her body.  Kru has her by the neck, waves his blades in front of her.  J gets up and runs toward him. Freddy pulls a foot up from the asphalt pit and KICKS Jac back a good fifteen feet. ALICE
Run, Jacob! The boy rolls painful on the hard road.  He sits up and  screams: JACOB
Leave her alone! FREDDY
You're such a momma's boy! Freddy swings his knives out, pauses for a terrifying bea then swoops the daggers towards Alice.
as OFF SCREEN we hear a horrible multiple GLITCH!  Jacob  shrieks in gut-wrenching anguish.

We're far enough away so that we don't barf at the sight close enough to see that Freddy has impaled Alice's body his blades.  He lifts her up effortlessly and raises her figure RIGHT OVER HIS HEAD. Krueger swings his arm out, shaking off Alice, sending he flying over Jacob's head.  The body lands behind him.

as he runs to his mother.  She VANISHES just as he reache out to touch her bloody body.  He turns to Krueger and ra his fists.  A look of sheer rage is growing in him, blind insane anger.  He bellows: JACOB
You fucker! FREDDY

Springwood is only the beginning.  All I  need from you is a ride! Suddenly, between Jacob and Freddy, three SHAFTS OF LIGHT burst up from the road.  Three FIGURES appear as the ligh dissipates. They're dressed in metallic black, heavy boots, helmets w dark visors covering their faces.  One is large and muscu The one in the center has an obviously feminine figure un her skin-tight outfit.  The third is a little smaller tha the other two with a slightly different face  that allows to see his mouth. They're the DREAM POLICE.  Jacob doesn't know this yet, b Freddy seems to.  The bastard son of a hundred maniacs fr at the sight of these new apparitions. Then he looks past them and smiles at Jacob. FREDDY (cont'd)

See ya later! Freddy violently DROPS down into the bubbling asphalt pit Two of the black figures start after him.  The third one  turns to Jacob as his partners leap into the hole after  Freddy.  The sound from his exposed mouth is DEAFENING! SOUND COP
Jacob grabs his ears in pain as we suddenly:

Jacob's eyes snap open so fast his sockets suffer whiplas He's lying smack in the middle of the road tucked in a fe position.  Jacob slowly uncurls his body and sits up.  He shivers and wipes his sweaty forehead - and that's when h notices something in his hand.

it's a bracelet, a simple band of gold with a larger plat the middle, like an ID band.  Jacob's fingers turn the pl over. Printed on the other side is the name of the bracel former owner: ALICE.  Jacob has a souvenir.

He raises his face and looks at the road in front of him. goes off into the distance surrounded on both sides by em fields.  This is where Springwood used to be.  A look of anguish  crosses Jacob's face as he stares at the desolation. JACOB
Mom...

Jacob whips his head around in time to see a huge moving blasting right at him.  He rolls off to the side of the r The truck barely misses him, kicking up a cloud of dust i its wake. Jacob chokes on the dust.  He slowly recovers and looks b down at the bracelet in his hand. He clenches his fist ar it as a wild-eyed angry look starts to grow on him.  He t a few deep breaths, then stands up and walks OUT OF FRAME
We can see a pickup truck in the distance. Jacob's HAND  ENTERS FRAME, thumb sticking out, his mother's bracelet  dangling from his wrist. The pickup truck starts to slow down.

A sprawling little community with pleasant streets and  cheerful houses.  It looks a lot like Springwood, the onl real difference being that it actually exists.  It also h sign: WELCOME TO ROSEDALE.  POPULATION: 8,786 A Volkswagon bus drives past the sign and stops a couple blocks down the road from us.  Jacob steps out of the  passenger side and wearily waves his ride goodbye.  He  shuffles into town.
It reads: DRUG ADDICTS NOT WELCOME TO ROSEDALE! The sign pulls away to reveal a middle-aged man with an a expression: MR. HOPKINS MR. HOPKINS
Clean up your act somewhere else! He walks along as we PULL BACK TO SEE
It's a nice-looking two-story house in the middle of a  usually quiet neighborhood.  Today the home is surrounded about a dozen townsfolk carrying picket signs: NO HALFWAY
VALUES!, and GO BACK TO JUVENILE HALL!  The crowd mumbles amongst itself, occasionally bursting out with a chant in protest.

We catch him walking down the sidewalk.  He tramps along his hands stuffed in his pockets and his eyes on the  pavement.  He looks like he hasn't slept in days.  The so of the crowd ahead of him finally grabs his attention. Jacob approaches the disturbance and comes across a young girl standing behind a bush holding a BAG OF GROCERIES. is KAREN MILLER, dark hair, sixteen, very pretty, but wit faraway look in her eyes. Jacob stands next to her and stares at the crowd like a  zombie.  She doesn't turn to look at him as he speaks: JACOB
What's going on? KAREN
Free speech.  The right of assembly. JACOB
What is this place? KAREN
It's a home.  A foster home.  For  teenagers.  It's where you go when things  get bad.  It's the place to figure out  what to do next.  It's a home for kids  that no one else wants. (beat)
It's MY home. Karen hasn't looked at Jacob once.  She suddenly seems to steel herself and walks away from the bush, towards the  house.  Jacob is befuddled. JACOB
Oh... He stands there and watches.

Karen quickly makes her way into the crowd of people, hea up, eyes staring forward.  The crowd parts ever so slight as the irked townsfolk start to heat up.  They have an ac human to vent their anger on now.  Mr. Hopkins lays in on as she passes him. MR. HOPKINS
Why can't you find somewhere else to  shack up? Karen turns to him, still walking, flustered and hurt. KAREN
What have we ever done to you? MR. HOPKINS

Nothing...YET. Karen turns quickly away from him and trips over a sprink head.  Her groceries tumble onto the grass.  A hand reach down to help her.  It's Jacob's. He quietly helps her re-bag her groceries as Mr. Hopkins  looms above them.  Both angry and embarrassed now. MR. HOPKINS (cont'd)
Look, we've been here for years.  This is  a quiet street.  We'd just like to keep  it that way. Jacob can't take this guy anymore.  He stands up and face the older man with a scowl. JACOB
Lighten up, mister. MR. HOPKINS (smirks)
And what gutter did you crawl out from,  kid? (frowns)
We don't want your kind here. JACOB
My kind?  What kind is that? MR. HOPKINS
Drug addicts.  Dope pushers.  We have  stand up and take charge. JACOB
Swell.  I've just got a couple of  questions for you...Do you love your  parents? MR. HOPKINS
Of course I do... JACOB
Are they alive? MR. HOPKINS
My mother is. JACOB
What's it like? Jacob stares at Hopkins.  He doesn't answer.  He just huf and puffs as Karen grabs Jacob and pulls him up to the fr porch of the home, then into the floor.
Karen slams the door and takes a deep breath. KAREN
Assholes. JACOB
I can think of a stronger word.  Are you  okay? KAREN
Yeah.  Thanks.  I'm Karen. JACOB
Jacob. Jacob suddenly gets a little light-headed and has to use wall to hold himself up.  Karen looks concerned. KAREN
Are YOU okay? JACOB
Yeah.  I just haven't had much to eat  lately. KAREN
Then come help me unpack. She smiles and leads him further into the house.
Jacob is feverishly eating a sandwich at the table while  Karen finishes putting the rest of the food away. KAREN
I guess the sandwich is alright, huh? JACOB
It's incredible.  Best I've ever had. KAREN
You're not from around here, are you? JACOB
No.  I've been on the road for a couple  of days. KAREN
Do you need a place to stay? FOOTSTEPS are heard from below and a couple in their mid- thirties enter from the basement door.  They're DAVID and MARY ROSS, both greasy and frustrated. MARY
So, we have to get it fixed. DAVID
We don't have the money to get it fixed. They both start washing up at the sink, not really notici the teenagers in the room.  Karen speaks up. KAREN
What's wrong? DAVID
Our plumbing has a bad case of hardening  of the arteries.  Who's your friend? David gives Jacob a wary glance as the boy stands shakily KAREN
This is Jacob. JACOB
Jacob Johnson. DAVID
David Ross.  My wife, Mary. KAREN

They run this house.  They're helping me  and three other ids get a footing in  reality before they kick us out of the  nest to make room for the next batch. David is looking out the window at the now dissipating cr He lets out a weary sigh. DAVID
If there is a next batch.  I see the  welcome wagon is back.  Was there any  trouble? KAREN
A little.  Jacob came to my rescue. MARY (pleasant)
Where you from, Jacob? JACOB
Springwood. MARY
Springwood?  Where's that? JACOB
Upstate about a hundred miles. DAVID (suspicious)
I know this state like the back of my  hand.  I've never heard of Springwood. There is an uncomfortable pause.  Then Karen suddenly bre in. KAREN
Jacob's a little down on his luck.  I  told him he could stay here a few days. Jacob gives here a surprised look. MARY
Are your parents in Springwood? JACOB
My father died before I was born.  My  mother, she's dead, too. DAVID
You have a legal guardian? JACOB
No. DAVID
Been in any state or federal program? JACOB
No. KAREN
Just for a little while.  So he can get  his bearings. DAVID
Got any ID? Jacob reaches for his back pocket - it's empty.  He shake his head "no". MARY (to David)

I think we can help him out, honey.  The  budget's tight, but we can't turn down  someone in need. David doesn't acknowledge his wife, he just stares at Jac sternly.  Karen bites her nails.  Then David sits down an starts to lecture. DAVID

Okay.  You got three, maybe four days to  rest up while we try and find a more  permanent arrangement for you.  But his  isn't going to be a free ride.  We're  part of a community summer work project  and eighty percent of the money you make  goes to the house.  Everybody works - and  that includes you.  Are you on drugs? JACOB
No. DAVID
Good.  If I catch anything stronger then  an aspirin on you, you're outta here.  No  arguments.  You got that straight? JACOB
Yes, sir. DAVID
Okay.  Dinner in two hours.  Why don't  you go meet the rest of the gang. KAREN
Thanks, David. MARY
I'll go fix up the spare bed in Wesley's  room. David gets up.  He gives Jacob a final once-over. DAVID
And take a shower, for chrissakes. David leaves the room.  Karen gives Jacob a huge grin.
Karen leads Jacob into the room.  There are two teenagers the couch: WESLEY is a fifteen-year old, curly hair, kind small.  GINA is also fifteen, brunette hair, seems pretty happy. KAREN
Hey, guys, I got someone for you to meet.   This is Jacob.  Jacob, this is Wesley and  Gina. JACOB
Hi. WESLEY
Welcome to fun central. KAREN
He's going to be staying with us for a  while. GINA

Oh yeah?  How'd you get through the  blockade? Another kid, SCOTT, pops into the room.  He's sixteen, da hair, with a tough-guy I could give a shit attitude.  He  doesn't seem to care about anybody in the room, except fo Karen. SCOTT
Hey, beautiful.  How's it going? KAREN
Hi, Scott. Scott notices Jacob and frowns.  Karen is a little annoye SCOTT
Who's Barney Rubble? KAREN
This is Jacob Johnson.  He's a new  resident.  At least temporarily. SCOTT
He better not be rooming with me.  I  value my privacy. KAREN
No, I believe that honor goes to Wesley. WESLEY
Good.  I could use the company. SCOTT
So what's your story?  Divorce?  Custody  battle?  Your parents just plain  assholes? JACOB
They're dead. KAREN
Mellow out, Scott.  Give him a chance to  settle in. SCOTT

Just curious. Scott reaches into his shirt pocket and pulls out a pack cigarettes.  As he lights one up, Wesley's cheerful attit suddenly turns grim.  He gets up from the couch and quick leaves the room.  Karen gives Scott an angry look. JACOB
Is he alright? SCOTT
He'll be fine.  He just has a problem  with cigarettes. GINA
His parents used to use them as a sick  kind of discipline.  That's why he's  here. JACOB
If you know that, then why do you smoke  in front of him? SCOTT
It's not my problem. This really pisses Jacob off.  These two are not going to along very well. JACOB
Just what is YOUR problem, then? SCOTT
I took care of my problem.  That's why  I'M here. Scott lets out an aloof puff of smoke and leaves.  Jacob  gives Karen a confused glance. KAREN
His dad used to beat him.  One day he  couldn't take it any more. JACOB
What happened? KAREN
He killed him with his father's gun.   Self-defense. Jacob sits down on the couch and lets that sink in.  Gina scootches away from him on the couch, then gives him a gl look. GINA
Everyone here has a fun tale to tell.   Isn't that right, Karen? Karen is staring out the window.  She has that spaced-out expression we saw before when she was hiding behind the b KAREN
Yeah.  Right. No one has anything left to say.  Gina turns the sound on TV back up as the three sad kids start to watch cartoons.

Jacob is alone in the dark watching some kind of NICK AT  NIGHT b&w sit-com re-run.  A cheerful family lovingly ban away on the flickering tube.  Jacob just stares blankly. Karen sleepily shows up at the doorway in a long tee-shir with a glass of milk. KAREN
Why don't you go to bed? JACOB
I can't sleep. KAREN
You need to talk? JACOB
No.  I'm fine.  Thanks. Karen gives him a worried look and heads off to bed.  Jac continues watching TV with a creepy glean in his tired ey

The kids are here cleaning up the building.  The guys thr rotted lumber into trash bins while the girls sweep up. catch Jacob and Scott tossing some debris into a wheelbar Jacob looks pretty ragged. SCOTT

Come on.  Let's hop to it.  Gotta make  way for those new indoor tennis courts.   The fate of the world lies in the  balance.  Okay, this load's full. Jacob grabs the handles of the wheelbarrow and shakily pi it up.  Scott sneers. SCOTT (cont'd)
You got that? JACOB
Yeah, no problem. SCOTT

I don't know.  Maybe you should think  about switching to de-caf or something. Jacob ignores him and pushes the wheelbarrow along.  Scot takes some time off to smoke a cigarette.  He spots Karen across the room bending over with a dustbin.  Scott linge on this view for a long time.

Jacob pulls up with the wheelbarrow and starts to unload junk.  Gina is next to the dumpster sweeping.  She tries push a large crate aside by herself, but slips and falls. Jacob jumps over to her, reaches out, and grabs her arm t help her up. JACOB
You okay? Gina SCREAMS. GINA
No!  Yes!  Let go of me! She shakes off his grip and he jumps back.  She runs away with a wild look in her eyes as Karen steps up to a confu Jacob. KAREN
She doesn't like to be touched. JACOB
No shit! KAREN
Don't take it personally.  It's not her  fault. JACOB
What happened to her? KAREN
Her mother was a hooker.  She forced Gina  to carry on the tradition.  When she was  thirteen... JACOB
Jesus. Jacob looks off at Gina with genuine concern.  Karen give him the same expression. KAREN
You look terrible. JACOB (smiling)
Thanks. KAREN
I'm sorry...I just wish you'd tell me  what happened to you, that's all. JACOB
I can't talk about it right now.  I'll  tell you later.  I promise. KAREN
Okay.  Why don't you sit and rest for a  bit.  The supervisor's not around.  You  look like you could use it. JACOB
I think I will. He gives her a gentle squeeze on the forearm, and Karen l it.  Jacob spots a pile of wood next to a wall and heads for it.
He's watched the entire interchange between Jacob and Kar and he DOESN'T like it.
as he goes around the stack of lumber and sits down facin the brick wall.  He lets out a heavy sigh and stares at t inside of the building.

He's got Gina! SOUND COP

Stand back. Everyone backs off.  Sound Cop opens his mouth.  BOOM!  A almost visible sound wave bursts forth from his lips and  CRACK, a huge hole is punched in the wall. The Police leap into the hole, quickly followed by Jacob.

This one's pretty normal.  Maybe the business suite.  And it's EMPTY except for a heart-shaped box of candy in the  middle of the bed.  Jacob and the rest of the Police watc Blade picks up the box and opens it.  Dozens of COCKROACH pour out onto the floor.  Now Jacob's really pissed. JACOB
You let him get away! SOUND COP
It's difficult. POWER COP
He's been at this longer than we have. BLADE COP
He can do anything. SOUND COP
But we have to catch him in the act to  get him. JACOB
What...there are rules to all this? SOUND COP
They're not rules. POWER COP
It's just the way it is. BLADE COP
Jacob, we need you to bring the rest  together. JACOB
The rest?  You mean the kids at the home? BLADE COP
Yes.  We need as many of you as we can  get.  And you must bring them to  Springwood. JACOB
How? BLADE COP
You have the power to link your dreams  with other's.  Dream of Springwood, then  bring the rest with you. SOUND COP
Living souls are what he thrives on.   Living souls are what we need to help  stop him. POWER COP
Before it's too late. BLADE COP
Before he takes everyone. SOUND COP
And every THING. Jacob just shakes his head.
All is BLACK.  Except for Freddy and Gina.  He has her fr behind, his hands locked on her shoulders. FREDDY

Ah...alone at last. Gina cries horribly like a person who knows death is seco away.  Freddy wraps his arms around her, hugging her. And he KEEPS wrapping his arms.  They STRETCH and elongat wrapping once around his body and then around her's again And then again.  Freddy's rubber limbs curl around and ar an around Gina's quivering body.  Spiraling up and down. Encircling on all sides on every part of her, touching an grabbing her EVERYWHERE. Until Krueger's arms cover her entirely.  Gina whimpers. FREDDY (cont'd)
Touching, isn't it? And he starts to SQUEEZE.  Gina gags as Freddy's snake-li embrace TIGHTENS around her, draining the life out of Gin body.
Jacob wakes with a start as the entire house around him  shakes. JACOB
Gina! Jacob jumps out of bed.
Jacob dashes down the corridor.  Karen comes out of her r KAREN
Is it an earthquake? JACOB
No.  It's Freddy. They run to Gina's room and fling the door open.

The RUMBLING of the house has stopped.  Gina's in bed, he tongue sticking grotesquely out from the corner of her mo her skin completely blue.  Jacob and Karen run to her to and help. Gina's already dead.  But Freddy's not quite done with he yet.  Jacob and Karen watch as Gina's chest CAVES IN.  Ka SCREAMS.

The coroner's back, the neighborhood gawks.  Jacob, Karen Scott sit on the front steps in a daze. But this time there are police barricades up.  In another part of the front yard we can see Mr. and Mrs. Ross with social worker, MR. SILVERMAN.  Mary Ross is crying while husband David is having a heated argument with Silverman. The kids watch on gloomily. The social worker leaves as Mr. Ross walks over to the ki Mary walks right by them and into the house - to broken u over something to talk. DAVID
Pack your bags, kids. JACOB
You're kicking us out? DAVID
No.  They're taking you away.  They say  it's for your own good. KAREN
They can't do that. DAVID

Yes, they can.  They consider Mary and I  possibly unfit to act as foster parents.   They're going to find temporary homes for  you until this mess is straightened out.   I'm so very sorry. Karen runs up to David and hugs him desperately.  He hold her. KAREN
No, please. DAVID
They're not calling it an accident this  time.  They don't really know what to  call it. Karen lets go.  Scott stands up. SCOTT
What's going to happen to us? DAVID
You'll be alright. KAREN
What's going to happen to you? DAVID
I don't know.  They're thinking of  pressing charges.   JACOB
Aw, Jesus... DAVID
Come on.  A car from juvenile hall will  be here in an hour. He leads them up the stairs.
A sign reads: ROSEDALE YOUTH CENTER.
Mr. Silverman, the social worker, is talking to the  teenagers.  Karen and Scott look understandably worried. Jacob looks like the world just ended for him. MR. SILVERMAN

I'm sure most of you know how this works  already.  You'll be assigned new foster  homes tomorrow afternoon.  Tomorrow  morning the police will be talking to you  regarding the matter at the old house. KAREN
What about it? MR. SILVERMAN
Anything you know. SCOTT
Are we considered suspects? MR. SILVERMAN
You'll talk to the police about that.   Don't worry.  We'll all try and work this  out. KAREN
Will we be able to go back to the Ross's? MR. SILVERMAN
I don't know.  You'll have a place to  stay in the mean time. KAREN
Will we be together? MR. SILVERMAN
No.  We don't have anybody willing to  take more than one person.  I'm afraid  you'll be split up. SCOTT
Great... MR. SILVERMAN
Hey, you can visit each other.  You'll be  in the same town. JACOB
If it's still here. Silverman frowns at that last comment as the kids get up leave.
The teenagers walk glumly out of the office.  Jacob is st strangely silent, not making eye contact with anyone. KAREN
Jacob, what are we going to do? JACOB
Nothing. KAREN
What do you mean, nothing? JACOB
It's over.  We're finished.  He's won. Jacob walks on ahead of them.  Karen is flabbergasted.  S stops and just stands there with Scott.  The two of them  watching Jacob walk away. SCOTT
Looks like your hero just gave up. And Karen still can't believe it.

Jacob is sitting on a bench looking like a beaten man and hating himself for it. Karen and Scott step out of a door.  They watch him for a seconds.  Then Karen walks towards Jacob.  Scott stays be and lights up a cigarette. KAREN
How can you do this? JACOB
Do what?  I'm not doing anything. KAREN
Exactly.  After all we've been through  you just throw in the towel.  Why? JACOB

Because we're fucked.  The last thing the  Dream Police told me was that they needed  all our help.  Together.  Even if we  weren't about to be split up there aren't  enough of us left to make a difference. KAREN
How do you know that? JACOB
I don't.  But, it's all just too much.   I've tried so hard and nothing's worked.   I'm spent.  I'm wasted.  I'm...I'm so  tired. Jacob puts his face in his hands. JACOB (cont'd)
I've had enough. KAREN

So you're just going to give up?  I'll  bet that's something your mother never  taught you. That hit home.  Jacob uncovers his face.  His ID bracelet dangles from his wrist.  He looks at the bracelet.  ALICE glints in the setting sunlight.  He remembers.  Jacob loo up at Karen. KAREN (cont'd)
We still have one night together. JACOB
And we're not going to waste it. Jacob stands up.
Jacob paces back and forth in front of Scott and Karen. KAREN
Scott, we need you. SCOTT
Look, I don't know what's going on  anymore.  Two of my friends die and now  you tell me I have to drop into dreamland  with you guys to do battle with the dude  that did it. JACOB
We'll have help. SCOTT

Ah, yes.  I almost forgot.  The Sleepy  Squad.  Alright.  I'll make you a deal.   I told you I wouldn't believe this stuff  unless I saw it.  If I understand this  correctly, all I have to do is fall  asleep and you just whisk me into the  action. JACOB
Right. SCOTT
Okay.  If that happens, if both of you  show up in my dream, I'll help you out.   If nothing happens, then I'll get a good  night's sleep and laugh at you in the  morning. JACOB
Fine.  You got a deal.  And you won't be  disappointed. KAREN
I'm going to be sleeping in the girl's  dorm.  Will you be able to bring me in? JACOB
I hope so.  Then I got to make sure we  all end up in Springwood. SCOTT
The old stomping ground? JACOB
Yeah.  Only right now it's not a very  pretty place. KAREN
What do we do when we get there? JACOB
Play it by ear.  And try and stay alive. A SOCIAL WORKER sticks his head into the lounge. SOCIAL WORKER
Half hour til lights out, everyone. The kids get up and start for the door. JACOB
Off we go. SCOTT
Into the wild black yonder. Scott shakes his head as they leave.
Karen lies in bed, under the covers.  She holds the pictu of herself, thirteen years old.  She stares at it.  Still that missing piece. Karen puts the picture on a nightstand and closes her eye
Scott lies on the top of a set of bunk beds.  Jacob is on bottom and already looks asleep.
He's still awake.  Maybe he's starting to believe some of Jacob's ramblings, because he nervously fidgets in bed. SCOTT

Freddy Krueger.  Yeah, right.  Years ago  some sicko gets fried and now he comes  back to stick it to you when you're  snoozing.  Stupid bedtime story. he sighs, looks at his wrist, but his watch isn't on.  Th SCOTT (cont'd)
Hey, Mr. Creepoid, you still up? (a beat)
Yo, Jacob? There's still no answer.  Scott rolls and peeks over the of the bunk bed.  And Jacob's not there. SCOTT (cont'd)
Huh? Scott sits up, looks around.  And FALLS right through the middle of his bed, NOT appearing underneath the top bunk. just disappears.

Scott falls out of a tree and lands with a THUD.  He groa slowly gets to his feet and takes in his surroundings. The road is dark and desolate.  The street lights emit a brown glow and there are no stars or moon in the sky. SOUNDS echo through the trees and buildings.  Weird MOANS odd GURGLINGS, eerie WHISPERS, and an occasional unearthl HOWL. This does not comfort Scott. SCOTT

Oh, this is lovely. He starts cautiously walking down the sidewalk.  SOMETHIN flies by with a FLAPPING.  Scott ducks.  Was it a bird or bat or what?  It's already gone. Then a craggy voice calls out from behind a tree. BUM
Hey, buddy? SCOTT
Yeah, what? Scott is understandably jumpy.  The dark figure of a BUM  starts walking towards him.  Scott backs away. BUM
Can you spare some change? SCOTT
Um, well, let me see... Scott starts sifting through his pockets, and the BUM ste out into the light. He has THREE EYES and a HUMP BACK.  Scott YELPS. SCOTT (cont'd)
Holy Jesus Christ. The Bum grins and Scott starts stumbling away, his voice  trailing off: SCOTT (cont'd)
I'll catch you next time, buddy. The mutant bum belches.

Karen rounds a corner.  She walks nervously down the midd of the street.  There are no cars, and she wants to keep far away as possible from the houses on either side.  There is a CREAKING sound from one of those houses.  Kare turns her head to look. A craggy OLD WOMAN is rocking back and forth on her front porch.  She's eating something, something stringy and sli She munches away with a vacant look in her eyes. The something in her hands MOVES slightly.  The old woman meal is still alive. Karen gags and walks faster.  And a PANTING sound is hear like two dogs.  Someone is walking their pet down the  sidewalk.   It's the MUTANT WOMAN from Jacob's opening nightmare:  straggly hair, oozing sores, limping.  The source of the  multiple paintings is her single dog, all two heads of it The mutant woman waves unpleasantly at Karen.  Karen whim and starts to RUN.

She stumbles quickly down the street.  We catch fleeting  glimpses of other horrors, twisted shapes, bent shadows. Karen rounds a corner, and SCREAMS when she bumps into  someone.  It's Scott, out of breath from his own sprintin KAREN
Scott!  You're here. SCOTT
Yeah.  Fun town.  Talk to any of the  neighbors, yet? They're a swell bunch of  folks.   KAREN
Uh-huh.  Real friendly, too. SCOTT
So this is a dream? KAREN
And I'm in it with you.  Convinced? SCOTT
Maybe I'm just dreaming bout being here  with you.  Wouldn't be the first time. KAREN
Nope.  I tired that one already.  Doesn't  work.  Come on, we have to find Jacob. Scott nods and they take off down the street.  A cat with three tails slithers by.
Jacob is standing motionless in the middle of the road. stares down into the darkness, a wooden expression on his face. Karen and Scott are running up behind him. KAREN
Jacob!  Thank God! SCOTT

So this is the place, huh? Jacob's eyes are steady.  He hasn't yet acknowledged the  other's presence.  He eyes are fixed on the gloominess in front of him.  A look of vengeance beginning to grow as o SHOT MOVES IN on him. JACOB
I'm home. Karen and Scott are next to him now.  They stand silently with Jacob for a few seconds.  Then: KAREN
What now? JACOB
Scott, are you with us? SCOTT
A deal's a deal. JACOB
Then we wait. And not for long.  FLASH!  In three bursts the Dream Poli appear directly across from the teenagers.  Scott and Kar jump back.  Jacob hold his ground. SCOTT
Whoa! The threesomes stand face-to-face in two parallel rows. SCOTT (cont'd)
Nice outfits. POWER COP
Is this all? JACOB
All that's left. SOUND COP
It'll have to do. SCOTT
We can always come back later.  Like when  it's daytime. POWER COP
It's always night here. JACOB
What's the plan? BLADE COP
We need you to draw him out. SCOTT
Terrific.  We're supposed to be bait. SOUND COP
Essentially. JACOB
Then let's do it. KABOOOOOOOOM!  A huge BRICK WALL, ten feet high and sprea out across the street and through the houses, BLASTS up f the asphalt.  Right between the Police and the kids.
The three cops crouch into battle positions.
The three of them have hardly any time to react before th perfectly round HOLES open up underneath each of them. And Scott, Jacob and Karen fall into darkness.

Sound Cop stands up and his body begins to VIBRATE.  A ne noise emits from his mouth: a HIGH PITCHED SQUEAL. And like the walls of Jericho, the bricks in front of the fall apart and tumble to the ground.  Dust settles and th Police walk over the rubble to the other side.  The kids gone. BLADE COP
Fan out. The Dream Police break formation and scatter.

A hole opens up in the road and WHOOSH, KAREN is elevated into the scene and the hole seals up instantly. She jumps  a few feet and drops to her knees, holding ont the ground.  She looks up at a street sign.  It reads: EL ST.  Karen stands up and heads down the road. EXT. ROCHESTER AVE. Another hole, and VOOM, Jacob is shot up into the street. spins around, trying to get his bearings.  It doesn't tak him long.  He knows exactly where he is. JACOB

Oh no... He starts to run and we FOLLOW him. Jacob jumps over a procession of RATS making their way ac the street and just keeps on sprinting.  Until he reaches certain house.  He catches his breath as he looks at the  building, pain registering on his face. JACOB (cont'd)
Mom... Jacob runs towards the house as our shot MOVES IN CLOSE t the mailbox and ate name printed across it.  It reads  JOHNSON.

Jacob bursts through the door.  He turns on a light switc A lamp SPUTTERS into semi-life, and keeps sputtering, cas a candle-like glow over the interior.   Cobwebs and dust cover everything.  Rats and tarantula  spiders skitter about.  Jacob grits his teeth and walks i deeper.

Scott BLASTS out of the asphalt.  He staggers for a few  seconds from the ride, then looks at the building in fron him.  A puttering neon sign, OSPRINGWOOD TAVERN', marks t local saloon.  Muffled MUSIC and VOICES seep through the  cracks of the double doors.  Scott looks around, then shrugs.  He heads for the entran

Dump is too clean a word, dive is too nice, abomination i more like it.  A greenish haze covers everything.  Instea sawdust on the floor there is a collection of debris that looks like a compilation of human teeth, crushed bugs, an pools of unmentionable goo. Then there's the people. Imagine any profanity, any obscenity,any blasphemy, add t all up - then double them.  It wouldn't even come close t the patrons of this joint. They dance, they yell, they drink bloody bubbling mixture There's a guy to the right that doesn't seem to mind that half his brain is showing.  That girl over there has no j In a booth is a couple that are connected at the lips.  A ventriloquist on stage is entertaining the troops with hi hand up the back of a real body. Scott steps through the door and blinks about a dozen tim Then he decides that the smart course of action is to tur around and go right back out. A MUTANT BOUNCER, half his face a skull, blocks Scott's w MUTANT BOUNCER
Two drink minimum. SCOTT
Ah, that's okay.  I think I'm underage,  anyway. MUTANT BOUNCER
Two drink minimum. SCOTT
No, really.  I'm driving. MUTANT BOUNCER

Two drink minimum. The bouncer with the limited vocabulary seems adamant.  S backs off and turns around.  He carefully moves forward. MUTANT WAITRESS with three breasts slips next to him. MUTANT WAITRESS
Can I get you anything? SCOTT
That's okay.  I'll just sit at the bar. MUTANT WAITRESS
Alright, honey.  You call if you need  anything. SCOTT

You bet.  You'll be the first to know. Scott turns away, trying to keep his eyes in their socket He slides up to the bar next to a MUTANT BUSINESSMAN.  Th man's head is on backwards, his arms lean on the bar whil his face looks out into the crowd.  He has to twist his n to sip his vile drink. A BARTENDER, surprisingly normal-looking, steps up to Sco BARTENDER
What'll it be? SCOTT

Um, a beer, I guess. The bartender fills a twisted glass with a sickly brown  liquid.  Chunks of matter float amongst the foam.  Scott  takes the drink warily and looks up at the businessman ne to him.  The mutant smiles at him. BARTENDER
Go on.  Puts hair on your back. SCOTT

And that's all? The bartender returns.  Holds one of those half pineapple type drinks in his hand, except this one has the back end a wriggling lizard sticking out of mucousy fluid under a umbrella.  He gives it to Scott. SCOTT (cont'd)
That's okay, this'll be plenty. BARTENDER
No charge.  Compliments of the man at the  end of the bar. The bartender walks away and Scott cranes his head to loo down the bar.
The crowd blocks his view, but we can see a gloved hand w four blades strapped to it tapping nonchalantly on the  surface of the wood.
He picks up his drinks, holding the moving one at arm's  length, and heads down the bar.

head_text.subj: AT THE END OF THE BAR

text: sits Freddy Krueger.  He sips coolly on some hideous  concoction as Scott sits down in the chair next to him an lights a cigarette, trying to look equally cool. FREDDY
Welcome to my favorite haunt. SCOTT
So you're the man. FREDDY
At your service. SCOTT
What's on your mind? FREDDY
A deal. SCOTT
A deal's what got me into this. FREDDY
Bring Jacob to me. Scott, valiantly holding on to his nerve, raises an eyebr SCOTT
What's in it for me? FREDDY

Power.  You don't need to hang out with  those losers. You're a take-charge kind  of guy, Scott.  Like when you took charge  of your father. Suddenly Freddy is spinning a gun on the bar with his fre hand.  Scott grimaces. SCOTT
Leave my father out of this. FREDDY
I'll make you mayor of Rosedale. SCOTT
After you make it look like this? FREDDY
You can have Karen. That was Freddy's trump card.  It really hits a nerve in  Scott.  Karen's everything he's ever wanted. SCOTT
Alive? FREDDY
Any way you want her. SCOTT (after a beat)
Okay. FREDDY
Shake? Krueger holds out his knives.  Scott shakes his head. SCOTT
No thanks.  I trust you. Freddy laughs.
Jacob opens the door into darkness. JACOB

Mother? He turns on the light and a RED HAZE blankets the room.   Jacob looks up.  The dish-like ceiling lamp is filled wit blood. Jacob walks into the room, tears welling.  He walks by  Alice's vanity, her makeup still sitting there as if she  might show up and use it at any moment. He steps up to a wardrobe closet and touches the edges of lightly.  He reaches out and slowly, almost reverently, o the doors.  Dozens of writhing SNAKES drop out of the closet and slit onto the ground. Jacob jumps back and SCREAMS. Then he just stands there in the middle of the teaming  reptile mass, not giving a shit anymore, going insane.  H fists clenched, his head tilted back, as he YELLS into th air like a wolf baying at the moon.
Scott steps off the sidewalk and looks up and down the  street.  He thinks and we MOVE IN on him. SCOTT
Mayor of Rosedale. Scott sneers. SCOTT (cont'd)
What a crock of shit. We PULL WIDER as Scott cups his hands around his mouth. SCOTT (cont'd)
Hey!  He's over here.  Yo!  Dream Police.   Hello!  Come on.  Move you collective  asses.
He puts his hands on his hips and sighs. SCOTT (cont'd)

Never a cop around when you need one. GLITCH! a stabbing sound of flesh, and Scott JERKS violen as our shot PULLS BACK to reveal: Freddy behind Scott, his deadly fingers buried in the boy back.  Scott chokes on his own blood as Krueger growls. FREDDY
I hate a snitch! Freddy pulls out his blades as Scott falls forward and wi his final breath utters: SCOTT

Eat shit... His body hits the ground with a THUD as a sudden ROAR fil the air.  Freddy looks around for its source.  And Sound drops down on him with a SMACK. The two of them tumble, then both jump up. Freddy laughs. Sound Cop looks down at Scott's body, then back up at  Krueger.  His body is shaking with fury,and he opens his  mouth. The loudest sound yet comes from Sound Cop.  KABOOM!  A b of air at Mach 3 smacks into Freddy and sends him sailing back, SMASHING right through the Tavern wall.

Freddy flies sideways, right through the bar, destroying  chandeliers as he careens through and punches yet another huge hole through the opposite wall. The nightmarish customers don't even seem to notice.
Jacob is shuffling down the stairs as a SONIC BOOM of noi echoes through the streets outside. He knows exactly what that sound means as we MOVE IN on h face. JACOB
Krueger... Jacob races for the front door.

The dust is just starting to settle as a THUD is heard co from the hole in the opposite wall.  Quickly followed by  Freddy's soaring body.  Krueger SMASHES into some tables slides across the floor.  Power Cop steps through the hol his fists clenched.  Freddy stands up and dusts himself o FREDDY

Lighten up, bone brain. Power Cop has no intention to.  He bolts over, grabs Krue raises him over his head like a wrestler, slams him down the bar, and SHOVES Freddy, knocking glasses and ashtrays aside until he SMACKS into yet another poor wall. Krueger barely gets back on his feet when Power Cop is ri on him again.  The big man in black SWINGS, but this time Freddy DUCKS.  CRACK! a support column bursts into dust. Freddy twirls around.  And the two of them start to PUNCH each other. It's a barroom brawl between non-humans as Power Cop and  Freddy Krueger exchange multiple blows. SMACK SMACK SMACK!  Freddy nails Power Cop, whose head ba seems to budge from the hits. POW POW POW!  Power Cop lays into Krueger, sending him  spinning and tumbling only to pick him up and start the  process all over again. This goes on for a while, and Krueger is losing. The mutant bouncer finally steps up to Power Cop to try a put a stop to all this. MUTANT BOUNCER

Take it outside! CRUNCH!  Power Cop puts a stop to the bouncer with a vici elbow in the chest.  All this gave Freddy a few seconds t grab a chair and crack it ineffectually over the Cop's he The pummeling begins again. THWACK THWACK THWACK!  Power Cop is punching Freddy towar the door.
Like in an old wester, Krueger flies out of the double do and somersaults onto the pavement.  Sound Cop is a few ya away knelt down next to Scott's dead body.  He looks up a Freddy sneers. FREDDY

No more playing around. Freddy raises his left fist and it begins to EXPAND.  It  grows like an inflated beach ball, except it doesn't look soft at all.  Freddy slides up to the side of the entranc and raises his giant hammer hand.  Power Cop steps throug looking for blood.  Sound Cop tries to warn him. SOUND COP

Kincaid! Too late.  BAM!  Freddy's fist slams down on Power Cop's  head.  He's actually shoved down into the ground a full t feet - trapped at the legs. BAM!  Freddy hits him again.  Power Cop is down to his th and he can't get out. A RUMBLING is heard.  Freddy turns to see Sound Cop start to open his mouth.  Krueger instantly reaches down and gr a brick from the rubble and THROWS it at Sound Cop. FREDDY

Put a lid on it! THUNK!  The brick lands squarely in Sound Cop's mouth,  stretching it painfully and blocking it completely.  Soun Cop reels from the impact.  Tries to pull out the firmly  wedged plug. Freddy turns back to Power Cop, BAM!  Hits him down to hi hips.  The giant fist swings, BAM BAM BAM BAM BAM! like  hammering a nail until Power Cop DISAPPEARS into the grou Freddy's hand deflates to regular size as he turns to the struggling Sound Cop. Sound Cop's head is EXPANDING.  Pressure seems to be buil up, something's gonna blow.  Freddy picks up a boulder fr the street rubble.  He catapults it with both hands at So Cop.  The boulder hits Sound Cop's head and takes it CLEA OFF. Sound Cop's decapitated skull tumbles away with the brick still stuck, as a blast of air shoots up from the stump o his neck with a SCREECH. Sound Cop's body stumbles for a few seconds, then falls o limply. Freddy LAUGHS and laughs and laughs... KACHUNK! until a K embeds itself in his back.  Krueger spins around. CHUNK CHUNK CHUNK!  Three more knives slam into his body he staggers back in surprise.  Blade Cop stands twenty fe away reaching into thin air and whipping out knife after  knife, flinging them at Freddy.  They sail like flying  bullets. CHUNK CHUNK CHUNK!  Krueger falls back from the sheer for of the onslaught, at least a dozen blades sticking out of body.   Blade stops. She stands there for a beat, waiting to see Freddy will do next. Krueger sways, looking like an inhuman pincushion.  Then grins.  His body steadies, and he suddenly poses like a b builder and flexes every muscle. POP POP POP!  The daggers shoot out of his torso and limb CLATTERING to the ground. The girl in black steps back and raises her arms.  SHINK  SHINK!  Two-foot-long sabers jut out from her forearms.   They're not held by her, they're a PART of her, exiting f the tops of her wrists under her clenched fists.  She cro the blades in front of her. FREDDY (cont'd) (smiling)
Ah... a girl after my own heart. KACHINK! Freddy shoots out his finger knives and they EXT to double their normal size.  He raises them and takes on fencing stance. FREDDY (cont'd)

En guard, bitch SWOOP/CLANG!  A swordfight ensues.  Freddy swinging his f long knives.  Blade slashing her rapier-arms.  They lunge they parry, they leap, they duck. CLANG!  They connect.  SCREEEEE.  Metal scrapes metal.  I a bastardized version of an Errol Flynn movie and Blade C and Freddy are equally matched.  Blade moves to get the u hand. CLINK CLINK!  Blades shoot out of the girl's ELBOWS.  Now when she takes a swing with her fists, another sword is r behind it on the follow-through. Freddy gets caught off-guard.  Gets slashed twice in the  shoulder and twirls away.  Then starts to move FASTER. Blade counters with an equally increased intensity.  Fred ducks, SWOOPS out twice quickly.  A fold of black cloth d down on Blade's stomach, revealing naked skin and a littl blood.  They pause for a second. FREDDY (cont'd)

Touche. And Blade becomes AIRBORNE putting a Samurai to shame,  twirling her legs up and out as a blade juts momentarily her RIGHT HEEL, chopping off Freddy's left hand. Krueger stumbles back in astonishment as green goo spurts of the stump. Astonishment turns to rage as the two converge again,  swinging away at an incredible rate.  An impossible rate. JACOB rounds the corner.  He stumbles into the action jus the battling pair are becoming an obscure swirling GLINTI MASS.  Pieces of them start to drop away. Blade's foot hits the ground.
